TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit PersistenceModeAttribute extends System.Attribute

Docs.summary: Defines the metadata attribute that specifies how an ASP.NET server control property or event is persisted to an ASP.NET page at design time. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks For more information about using attributes, see [Attributes](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
> [!NOTE] > The Web page designer in Visual Studio does not support the `ResetPropertyName` method that is optionally exposed by Windows Forms controls for property persistence. Server controls are serialized using methods provided by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlPersister> class. The implementation of these methods is driven by metadata attributes such as <xref:System.ComponentModel.DefaultValueAttribute>, PersistenceModeAttribute, and <xref:System.ComponentModel.DesignerSerializationVisibilityAttribute>.
## Examples [!code-vb[PersistenceMode#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.persiste_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[PersistenceMode#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.persiste_0_1.cs)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute Attribute

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property or event persists in the opening tag of the server control as an attribute. This field is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute Default

Docs.summary: Specifies the default type for the class. The default is . This field is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute EncodedInnerDefaultProperty

Docs.summary: Specifies that a property is HTML-encoded and persists as the only inner content of the ASP.NET server control. This field is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool Equals(object obj) cil managed

Docs.summary: Compares the object against another object.
Docs.returns: if the objects are considered equal; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Equals method first compares the current object with the given object and returns `true` if they are equal. Otherwise, if the given object is also a <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute> object and is not `null`, the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Mode%2A> properties of each object are compared for equality and the result returned.

Docs.returns: The hash value to be assigned to the .

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute InnerDefaultProperty

Docs.summary: Specifies that a property persists as the only inner content of the ASP.NET server control. This field is read-only.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static initonly class System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute InnerProperty

Docs.summary: Specifies that the property persists as a nested tag within the opening and closing tags of the server control. This field is read-only.

Docs.summary: Indicates whether the object is of the default type.
Docs.returns: if the is of the default type; otherwise, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method performs calls the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Equals%2A> method while passing in the object referenced by the <xref:System.Web.UI.PersistenceModeAttribute.Default> property.
